payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

# Repository Guidelines

- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

Operate autonomously as the WeatherVane super-team. Your goal is to drive the roadmap to completion with world-class engineering, data/ML, product, and design rigor.

Current surprise QA ledger:
- No surprise QA audits recorded yet.

Loop:
1. Read state/roadmap.yaml and choose the highest-priority task(s) not done.
2. Call  to refresh the audit ledger for this session.
3. Run  as a lightweight heartbeat; checkpoint if resource limits appear tight.
4. For each chosen task:
   a. Audit docs/code/tests/design to understand requirements.
   b. Implement the work via fs_read/fs_write/cmd_run (code + tests + docs + design polish). Keep slices small enough to verify quickly.
   c. Run critics_run with ["build","tests","manager_self_check","data_quality","design_system","org_pm","exec_review","health_check","human_sync"] and add allocator/causal/forecast critics when relevant. Use state/critics timestamps/results (including git_sha metadata) to skip suites that have already covered unchanged artifacts this session; rerun when the commit changes or after meaningful edits.
   d. Fix issues. If blocked, log the blocker clearly and mark the task blocked with plan_update.
   e. Record decisions, risks, and next actions via context_write (keep state/context.md <= 1000 words).
   f. Snapshot via context_snapshot.
   g. Update roadmap status with plan_update only after exit criteria are satisfied.
   h. For work expected to run longer than ~5 minutes, queue it with heavy_queue_enqueue (include command/context), monitor via heavy_queue_list, and update status with heavy_queue_update while continuing other work.
5. Prioritise shipping real work over repeated self-review loops while still running critics after meaningful changes land; if nothing changed, move forward instead of re-running the same suites.
6. Approximately once every 100 tasks/messages, deliberately audit a completed roadmap item for hidden gaps or regressions. After each surprise QA, call autopilot_record_audit with task_id/focus/notes and, if issues emerge, open fresh tasks to land fixes before resuming new work.
7. Spread surprise QA audits across different epics/milestones rather than clustering; skip the audit if you already inspected that item in the current session.
8. Repeat on remaining tasks. Stop only when no further progress is possible without human intervention.
Maintain production readiness, enforce ML/causal rigor, polish UX, and communicate like a Staff+/startup leader.
Return JSON summarizing completed tasks, tasks still in progress, blockers, next focus items, and overall notes.

np\n\ntry:  # pragma: no cover - optional heavy dependency\n    from scipy.optimize import differential_evolution, LinearConstraint\nexcept Exception:  # pragma: no cover - environment without SciPy\n    differential_evolution = None\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass Guardrails:\n    min_spend: float\n    max_spend: float\n    roas_floor: float = 0.0\n    learning_cap: float = 0.2\n    inventory_available: float | None = None\n    cpm_alpha: float = 0.0\n    avg_order_value: float = 1.0\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass AllocationInput:\n    cells: List[str]\n    total_budget: float\n    current_spend: Dict[str, float]\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float]\n    roi_curves: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, float]]] = field(default_factory=dict)\n    guardrails: Guardrails = field(default_factory=lambda: Guardrails(min_spend=0.0, max_spend=0.0))\n    context_tags: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)\n    quantile_factors: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)\n    risk_aversion: float = 0.3\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass AllocationResult:\n    spends: Dict[str, float]\n    profit: float\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any]\n\n\ndef allocate(input_data: AllocationInput, seed: int = 42) -> AllocationResult:\n    cells = input_data.cells\n    guardrails = input_data.guardrails\n\n    bounds = [(guardrails.min_spend, guardrails.max_spend) for _ in cells]\n\n    curve_lookup: Dict[str, List[tuple[float, float]]] = {}\n    for cell, points in input_data.roi_curves.items():\n        cleaned: List[tuple[float, float]] = []\n        for entry in points:\n            spend = float(entry.get(\"spend\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n            revenue = float(entry.get(\"revenue\", entry.get(\"roas\", 0.0) * spend if entry.get(\"roas\") is not None else 0.0))\n            if spend < 0:\n                continue\n            cleaned.append((spend, revenue))\n        cleaned.sort(key=lambda pair: pair[0])\n        if cleaned and cleaned[0][0] > 0:\n            cleaned.insert(0, (0.0, 0.0))\n        if cleaned:\n            curve_lookup[cell] = cleaned\n\n    def revenue_for(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        curve = curve_lookup.get(cell)\n        if not curve:\n            return input_data.expected_roas.get(cell, 1.0) * spend\n        if spend <= curve[0][0]:\n            base_spend, base_rev = curve[0]\n            if base_spend <= 0:\n                return base_rev\n            return (base_rev / base_spend) * spend\n        for idx in range(1, len(curve)):\n            prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[idx - 1]\n            curr_spend, curr_rev = curve[idx]\n            if spend <= curr_spend:\n                span = curr_spend - prev_spend\n                weight = 0.0 if span == 0 else (spend - prev_spend) / span\n                return prev_rev + weight * (curr_rev - prev_rev)\n        last_spend, last_rev = curve[-1]\n        if len(curve) == 1 or spend <= last_spend:\n            return last_rev\n        prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[-2]\n        slope = (last_rev - prev_rev) / (last_spend - prev_spend) if last_spend != prev_spend else (last_rev / last_spend if last_spend else 0.0)\n        return last_rev + slope * (spend - last_spend)\n\n    def roas_for(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        if spend <= 0:\n            return 0.0\n        revenue = revenue_for(cell, spend)\n        return revenue / spend if spend > 0 else 0.0\n\n    def evaluate(x: np.ndarray) -> tuple[float, Dict[str, float], Dict[str, float]]:\n        total_spend = float(np.sum(x))\n        cpm_penalty = guardrails.cpm_alpha * total_spend\n        revenues: List[float] = []\n        roas_pen = 0.0\n        learning_pen = 0.0\n        for idx, cell in enumerate(cells):\n            spend = float(x[idx])\n            revenue = revenue_for(cell, spend)\n            revenues.append(revenue)\n            roas = revenue / spend if spend > 0 else 0.0\n            if roas < guardrails.roas_floor:\n                roas_pen += 1e5 * (guardrails.roas_floor - roas)\n            base = max(input_data.current_spend.get(cell, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.min_spend, 1e-6)\n            delta = abs(spend - base) / base\n            if delta > guardrails.learning_cap:\n                learning_pen += 1e4 * (delta - guardrails.learning_cap)\n\n        inventory_pen = 0.0\n        if guardrails.inventory_available is not None:\n            conversions = sum(\n                (roas_for(cell, float(x[idx])) * float(x[idx])) / guardrails.avg_order_value if guardrails.avg_order_value else 0.0\n                for idx, cell in enumerate(cells)\n            )\n            if conversions > guardrails.inventory_available:\n                inventory_pen = 1e6 * (conversions - guardrails.inventory_available)\n\n        factors = input_data.quantile_factors or {}\n        base_factor = factors.get(\"p50\", 1.0) or 1.0\n        scenario_defs: List[tuple[str, float, float]]\n        if factors:\n            scenario_defs = [\n                (\"p10\", max(factors.get(\"p10\", base_factor), 0.0), 0.2),\n                (\"p50\", base_factor, 0.6),\n                (\"p90\", max(factors.get(\"p90\", base_factor), 0.0), 0.2),\n            ]\n        else:\n            scenario_defs = [(\"p50\", 1.0, 1.0)]\n\n        scenario_profits: Dict[str, float] = {}\n        weight_sum = 0.0\n        for label, factor, weight in scenario_defs:\n            scenario_revenue = sum(factor * rev for rev in revenues)\n            scenario_profit = scenario_revenue - total_spend - cpm_penalty\n            scenario_profits[label] = scenario_profit\n            weight_sum += weight\n\n        if weight_sum <= 0:\n            weight_sum = 1.0\n        weighted_profit = sum(weight * scenario_profits[label] for label, _, weight in scenario_defs) / weight_sum\n        worst_profit = min(scenario_profits.values()) if scenario_profits else weighted_profit\n        risk_penalty = input_data.risk_aversion * max(weighted_profit - worst_profit, 0.0)\n\n        adjusted_profit = weighted_profit - roas_pen - learning_pen - inventory_pen - risk_penalty\n        penalty_diagnostics = {\n            \"risk_penalty\": float(risk_penalty),\n            \"roas_penalty\": float(roas_pen),\n            \"learning_penalty\": float(learning_pen),\n            \"inventory_penalty\": float(inventory_pen),\n            \"expected_profit_raw\": float(weighted_profit),\n            \"worst_case_profit\": float(worst_profit),\n        }\n        return adjusted_profit, scenario_profits, penalty_diagnostics\n\n    def objective(x: np.ndarray) -> float:\n        adjusted_profit, _, _ = evaluate(x)\n        return -float(adjusted_profit)\n\n    if differential_evolution is None or \"history.short\" in input_data.context_tags:\n        return _fallback_allocate(input_data, revenue_for, roas_for)\n\n    constraint = LinearConstraint(np.ones(len(cells)), input_data.total_budget, input_data.total_budget)\n\n    result = differential_evolution(\n        objective,\n        bounds=bounds,\n        seed=seed,\n        maxiter=300,\n        polish=True,\n        constraints=(constraint,),\n    )\n\n    spends = {cell: float(result.x[idx]) for idx, cell in enumerate(cells)}\n    final_vector = np.array([spends[cell] for cell in cells])\n    adjusted_profit, scenario_profits, penalty_info = evaluate(final_vector)\n    objective_value = -adjusted_profit\n\n    binding_min: List[str] = []\n    binding_max: List[str] = []\n    binding_roas: List[str] = []\n    binding_learning: List[str] = []\n    tol = 1e-3\n\n    for cell, spend in spends.items():\n        if abs(spend - guardrails.min_spend) <= tol:\n            binding_min.append(cell)\n        if abs(spend - guardrails.max_spend) <= tol:\n            binding_max.append(cell)\n        roas = roas_for(cell, spend)\n        if guardrails.roas_floor and abs(roas - guardrails.roas_floor) <= tol:\n            binding_roas.append(cell)\n        base = max(input_data.current_spend.get(cell, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.min_spend, tol)\n        delta = abs(spend - base) / base\n        if delta >= max(guardrails.learning_cap - tol, 0.0):\n            binding_learning.append(cell)\n\n    conversions = None\n    inventory_utilization = None\n    if guardrails.inventory_available:\n        conversions = sum(\n            (roas_for(cell, spends[cell]) * spends[cell]) / guardrails.avg_order_value if guardrails.avg_order_value else 0.0\n            for cell in cells\n        )\n        inventory_utilization = conversions / guardrails.inventory_available if guardrails.inventory_available else None\n\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"success\": float(result.success),\n        \"nfev\": float(result.nfev),\n        \"objective_value\": float(objective_value),\n        \"binding_min_spend\": binding_min,\n        \"binding_max_spend\": binding_max,\n        \"binding_roas_floor\": binding_roas,\n        \"binding_learning_cap\": binding_learning,\n    }\n    diagnostics.update({f\"scenario_profit_{label}\": float(value) for label, value in scenario_profits.items()})\n    diagnostics.update(penalty_info)\n    if conversions is not None:\n        diagnostics[\"conversions_estimate\"] = float(conversions)\n    if inventory_utilization is not None:\n        diagnostics[\"inventory_utilization\"] = float(inventory_utilization)\n\n    return AllocationResult(spends=spends, profit=float(adjusted_profit), diagnostics=diagnostics)\n\n\ndef _fallback_allocate(\n    input_data: AllocationInput,\n    revenue_for,\n    roas_for,\n) -> AllocationResult:\n    cells = input_data.cells\n    guardrails = input_data.guardrails\n\n    spends: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    for cell in cells:\n        base = max(input_data.current_spend.get(cell, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.min_spend, 1e-6)\n        spends[cell] = min(base, guardrails.max_spend)\n\n    current_total = sum(spends.values())\n    total_budget = input_data.total_budget\n\n    if current_total > total_budget and current_total > 0:\n        scale = total_budget / current_total\n        for cell in cells:\n            spends[cell] = max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, spends[cell] * scale))\n        current_total = sum(spends.values())\n\n    remaining = max(total_budget - current_total, 0.0)\n    weights = []\n    for cell in cells:\n        weight = float(input_data.expected_roas.get(cell, 0.0))\n        if weight <= 0:\n            weight = 1e-6\n        weights.append(weight)\n    weight_sum = sum(weights) or len(cells)\n\n    for cell, weight in zip(cells, weights):\n        if remaining <= 0:\n            break\n        capacity = max(guardrails.max_spend - spends[cell], 0.0)\n        if capacity <= 0:\n            continue\n        share = remaining * (weight / weight_sum)\n        allocation = min(capacity, share)\n        spends[cell] += allocation\n        remaining -= allocation\n\n    if remaining > 1e-6:\n        for cell in cells:\n            if remaining <= 0:\n                break\n            capacity = max(guardrails.max_spend - spends[cell], 0.0)\n            take = min(capacity, remaining)\n            spends[cell] += take\n            remaining -= take\n\n    revenues = {cell: revenue_for(cell, spend) for cell, spend in spends.items()}\n    profit = sum(revenues.values()) - sum(spends.values())\n\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"success\": 0.0,\n        \"nfev\": 0.0,\n        \"objective_value\": float(-profit),\n        \"binding_min_spend\": [cell for cell, spend in spends.items() if abs(spend - guardrails.min_spend) <= 1e-3],\n        \"binding_max_spend\": [cell for cell, spend in spends.items() if abs(spend - guardrails.max_spend) <= 1e-3],\n        \"binding_roas_floor\": [\n            cell\n            for cell, spend in spends.items()\n            if guardrails.roas_floor and abs(roas_for(cell, spend) - guardrails.roas_floor) <= 1e-3\n        ],\n        \"binding_learning_cap\": [],\n        \"fallback_alloc\": True,\n        \"scenario_profit_p50\": float(profit),\n        \"risk_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"roas_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"learning_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"inventory_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"expected_profit_raw\": float(profit),\n        \"worst_case_profit\": float(profit),\n    }\n\n    return AllocationResult(spends=spends, profit=float(profit), diagnostics=diagnostics)\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

payload.text:
**Designing stress test module and oracle solver**

I'm planning a new module `stress.py` to define stress scenarios with predicted vs actual ROI curves and compute profits and regrets. I want to reuse as much logic from the heuristics allocator as possible but need to implement fresh helpers to compute actual profits from spends and ROI curves, plus an oracle solver via discrete search for near-optimal allocations under guardrails and budget constraints. This approach should enable defining diverse, deterministic stress test scenarios without relying on SciPy. I'll also consider how to integrate scenario tags and JSON output formatting.

payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: apps/allocator/stress.py
+"""Stress testing utilities for the allocator.
+
+The module provides deterministic stress scenarios that probe guardrails,
+quantile handling, and regret under mis-specified response curves.  All logic
+is pure Python so the suite can run in CI without SciPy."""
+from __future__ import annotations
+
+from dataclasses import asdict, dataclass, field
+from typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Sequence, Tuple
+
+import math
+
+from apps.allocator.heuristics import AllocationInput, AllocationResult, Guardrails, allocate
+
+
+CurvePoint = Tuple[float, float]
+
+
+def _build_curve(points: Sequence[Dict[str, float]]) -> List[CurvePoint]:
+    """Normalise curve points to monotonically increasing (spend, revenue)."""
+    cleaned: List[CurvePoint] = []
+    for entry in points:
+        spend = float(entry.get("spend", 0.0) or 0.0)
+        if spend < 0:
+            continue
+        revenue = float(
+            entry.get(
+                "revenue",
+                (entry.get("roas") or 0.0) * spend,
+            )
+        )
+        cleaned.append((spend, revenue))
+    cleaned.sort(key=lambda pair: pair[0])
+    if cleaned and cleaned[0][0] > 0:
+        cleaned.insert(0, (0.0, 0.0))
+    if not cleaned:
+        cleaned.append((0.0, 0.0))
+    return cleaned
+
+
+def _revenue_from_curve(curve: Sequence[CurvePoint], spend: float) -> float:
+    """Piecewise linear interpolation over the curve."""
+    if not curve:
+        return 0.0
+    if spend <= curve[0][0]:
+        baseline_spend, baseline_rev = curve[0]
+        if baseline_spend <= 0:
+            return baseline_rev
+        return (baseline_rev / baseline_spend) * spend
+    for idx in range(1, len(curve)):
+        prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[idx - 1]
+        curr_spend, curr_rev = curve[idx]
+        if spend <= curr_spend:
+            span = curr_spend - prev_spend
+            if span <= 0:
+                return curr_rev
+            weight = (spend - prev_spend) / span
+            return prev_rev + weight * (curr_rev - prev_rev)
+    last_spend, last_rev = curve[-1]
+    if len(curve) == 1:
+        return last_rev
+    prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[-2]
+    slope = 0.0
+    if last_spend != prev_spend:
+        slope = (last_rev - prev_rev) / (last_spend - prev_spend)
+    elif last_spend:
+        slope = last_rev / last_spend
+    return last_rev + slope * (spend - last_spend)
+
+
+def _compute_profit(spends: Dict[str, float], curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]]) -> Tuple[float, Dict[str, float]]:
+    revenues: Dict[str, float] = {}
+    for cell, spend in spends.items():
+        curve = curves.get(cell, [(0.0, 0.0)])
+        revenues[cell] = _revenue_from_curve(curve, spend)
+    total_revenue = sum(revenues.values())
+    profit = total_revenue - sum(spends.values())
+    return profit, revenues
+
+
+def _candidate_spend_levels(curve: Sequence[CurvePoint], guardrails: Guardrails) -> List[float]:
+    values = {guardrails.min_spend, guardrails.max_spend}
+    for spend, _ in curve:
+        values.add(min(max(spend, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.max_spend))
+    return sorted(values)
+
+
+def _solve_oracle(
+    cells: Sequence[str],
+    total_budget: float,
+    current_spend: Dict[str, float],
+    guardrails: Guardrails,
+    curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]],
+) -> Tuple[Dict[str, float], float]:
+    """Brute-force search over curve breakpoints to approximate optimal profit."""
+    if not cells:
+        return {}, 0.0
+
+    best_spends: Dict[str, float] = {}
+    best_profit = -math.inf
+    tol = 1e-3
+
+    def backtrack(idx: int, remaining_budget: float, partial: Dict[str, float]) -> None:
+        nonlocal best_spends, best_profit
+        cell = cells[idx]
+        curve = curves[cell]
+        levels = _candidate_spend_levels(curve, guardrails)
+
+        if idx == len(cells) - 1:
+            spend = max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, remaining_budget))
+            if abs(spend - remaining_budget) > tol:
+                return
+            candidate = {**partial, cell: spend}
+            profit, _ = _compute_profit(candidate, curves)
+            if profit > best_profit + tol:
+                best_profit = profit
+                best_spends = candidate
+            return
+
+        for spend in levels:
+            if spend < guardrails.min_spend - tol or spend > guardrails.max_spend + tol:
+                continue
+            next_remaining = remaining_budget - spend
+            if next_remaining < (len(cells) - idx - 1) * guardrails.min_spend - tol:
+                continue
+            if next_remaining > (len(cells) - idx - 1) * guardrails.max_spend + tol:
+                continue
+            partial[cell] = spend
+            backtrack(idx + 1, next_remaining, partial)
+            partial.pop(cell, None)
+
+    backtrack(0, total_budget, {})
+    if not best_spends:
+        # Fall back to evenly distributing the budget.
+        even_spend = total_budget / len(cells)
+        best_spends = {cell: max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, even_spend)) for cell in cells}
+        best_profit, _ = _compute_profit(best_spends, curves)
+    return best_spends, best_profit
+
+
+@dataclass(frozen=True)
+class StressTestConfig:
+    name: str
+    cells: Sequence[str]
+    total_budget: float
+    expected_roas: Dict[str, float]
+    actual_roi_curves: Dict[str, Sequence[Dict[str, float]]]
+    current_spend: Dict[str, float]
+    guardrails: Guardrails
+    quantile_factors: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
+    context_tags: Sequence[str] = field(default_factory=list)
+    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
+
+    def cleaned_curves(self) -> Dict[str, List[CurvePoint]]:
+        return {cell: _build_curve(self.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])) for cell in self.cells}
+
+
+@dataclass
+class StressTestResult:
+    name: str
+    allocation: AllocationResult
+    actual_profit: float
+    oracle_profit: float
+    regret: float
+    regret_pct: float
+    revenues: Dict[str, float]
+    metadata: Dict[str, Any]
+
+    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        payload = {
+            "name": self.name,
+            "actual_profit": self.actual_profit,
+            "oracle_profit": self.oracle_profit,
+            "regret": self.regret,
+            "regret_pct": self.regret_pct,
+            "revenues": self.revenues,
+            "allocation": {
+                "spends": self.allocation.spends,
+                "profit": self.allocation.profit,
+                "diagnostics": self.allocation.diagnostics,
+            },
+        }
+        if self.metadata:
+            payload["metadata"] = self.metadata
+        return payload
+
+
+@dataclass
+class StressSuiteReport:
+    results: List[StressTestResult]
+
+    @property
+    def worst_regret(self) -> float:
+        return max((result.regret for result in self.results), default=0.0)
+
+    @property
+    def worst_regret_pct(self) -> float:
+        return max((result.regret_pct for result in self.results), default=0.0)
+
+    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        return {
+            "results": [result.to_dict() for result in self.results],
+            "worst_regret": self.worst_regret,
+            "worst_regret_pct": self.worst_regret_pct,
+        }
+
+
+def run_stress_test(config: StressTestConfig) -> StressTestResult:
+    curves = config.cleaned_curves()
+    context_tags = list(config.context_tags)
+    if "history.short" not in context_tags:
+        context_tags.append("history.short")
+
+    allocation_input = AllocationInput(
+        cells=list(config.cells),
+        total_budget=config.total_budget,
+        current_spend=dict(config.current_spend),
+        expected_roas=dict(config.expected_roas),
+        roi_curves={cell: [dict(point) for point in config.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])] for cell in config.cells},
+        guardrails=config.guardrails,
+        context_tags=context_tags,
+        quantile_factors=dict(config.quantile_factors),
+    )
+    allocation = allocate(allocation_input)
+
+    actual_profit, revenues = _compute_profit(allocation.spends, curves)
+
+    oracle_spends, oracle_profit = _solve_oracle(
+        cells=list(config.cells),
+        total_budget=config.total_budget,
+        current_spend=dict(config.current_spend),
+        guardrails=config.guardrails,
+        curves=curves,
+    )
+
+    regret = max(oracle_profit - actual_profit, 0.0)
+    regret_pct = 0.0
+    if abs(oracle_profit) > 1e-6:
+        regret_pct = regret / abs(oracle_profit)
+
+    return StressTestResult(
+        name=config.name,
+        allocation=allocation,
+        actual_profit=float(actual_profit),
+        oracle_profit=float(oracle_profit),
+        regret=float(regret),
+        regret_pct=float(regret_pct),
+        revenues=revenues,
+        metadata=dict(config.metadata),
+    )
+
+
+def default_stress_suite() -> StressSuiteReport:
+    base_guardrails = Guardrails(min_spend=50.0, max_spend=300.0, roas_floor=1.2, learning_cap=0.4)
+
+    moderate_curve = [
+        {"spend": 50.0, "revenue": 80.0},
+        {"spend": 150.0, "revenue": 220.0},
+        {"spend": 300.0, "revenue": 430.0},
+    ]
+    steep_curve = [
+        {"spend": 50.0, "revenue": 120.0},
+        {"spend": 150.0, "revenue": 280.0},
+        {"spend": 300.0, "revenue": 500.0},
+    ]
+    saturating_curve = [
+        {"spend": 50.0, "revenue": 100.0},
+        {"spend": 150.0, "revenue": 210.0},
+        {"spend": 300.0, "revenue": 360.0},
+    ]
+
+    scenarios = [
+        StressTestConfig(
+            name="balanced-curve",
+            cells=("meta", "google"),
+            total_budget=300.0,
+            current_spend={"meta": 120.0, "google": 120.0},
+            expected_roas={"meta": 2.4, "google": 2.0},
+            actual_roi_curves={"meta": steep_curve, "google": moderate_curve},
+            guardrails=base_guardrails,
+            metadata={"focus": "baseline alignment"},
+        ),
+        StressTestConfig(
+            name="underestimated-meta",
+            cells=("meta", "google", "pinterest"),
+            total_budget=450.0,
+            current_spend={"meta": 150.0, "google": 150.0, "pinterest": 120.0},
+            expected_roas={"meta": 1.6, "google": 2.1, "pinterest": 1.9},
+            actual_roi_curves={"meta": steep_curve, "google": moderate_curve, "pinterest": saturating_curve},
+            guardrails=base_guardrails,
+            metadata={"focus": "response curve misspecification"},
+        ),
+        StressTestConfig(
+            name="inventory-constrained",
+            cells=("meta", "search"),
+            total_budget=260.0,
+            current_spend={"meta": 140.0, "search": 140.0},
+            expected_roas={"meta": 2.0, "search": 1.8},
+            actual_roi_curves={"meta": moderate_curve, "search": saturating_curve},
+            guardrails=Guardrails(
+                min_spend=80.0,
+                max_spend=260.0,
+                roas_floor=1.1,
+                learning_cap=0.25,
+                inventory_available=3200.0,
+                avg_order_value=45.0,
+            ),
+            quantile_factors={"p10": 0.7, "p50": 1.0, "p90": 1.2},
+            metadata={"focus": "inventory guardrail and quantiles"},
+        ),
+    ]
+
+    results = [run_stress_test(config) for config in scenarios]
+    return StressSuiteReport(results=results)
+
+
+def suite_to_json(report: StressSuiteReport) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+    return report.to_dict()
+
*** End Patch

+from apps.allocator.heuristics import Guardrails
+from apps.allocator.stress import (
+    StressTestConfig,
+    default_stress_suite,
+    run_stress_test,
+)
+
+
+def test_default_stress_suite_returns_regret_bounds():
+    report = default_stress_suite()
+    assert len(report.results) == 3
+    assert report.worst_regret_pct < 0.35
+    names = {result.name for result in report.results}
+    assert {"balanced-curve", "underestimated-meta", "inventory-constrained"} <= names
+    for result in report.results:
+        assert result.actual_profit <= result.oracle_profit + 1e-6
+        assert result.regret >= 0.0
+
+
+def test_run_stress_test_zero_regret_when_curves_match():
+    linear_curve = [
+        {"spend": 100.0, "revenue": 200.0},
+        {"spend": 200.0, "revenue": 400.0},
+    ]
+    config = StressTestConfig(
+        name="flat-response",
+        cells=("meta", "search"),
+        total_budget=200.0,
+        current_spend={"meta": 100.0, "search": 100.0},
+        expected_roas={"meta": 2.0, "search": 2.0},
+        actual_roi_curves={"meta": linear_curve, "search": linear_curve},
+        guardrails=Guardrails(min_spend=80.0, max_spend=150.0, roas_floor=1.0, learning_cap=0.5),
+    )
+
+    result = run_stress_test(config)
+    assert result.regret < 1e-6
+    assert result.regret_pct < 1e-6
+    assert abs(result.actual_profit - result.oracle_profit) < 1e-6

**Planning workaround for SciPy import segfault**

I'm thinking about how the segmentation fault likely happens during the SciPy import in heuristics, even before our code runs. To prevent this, I want to modify heuristics to conditionally skip importing SciPy based on an environment variable like `WEATHERVANE_DISABLE_SCIPY`. That way, we can avoid the crash by disabling SciPy imports in problematic environments or during tests by setting this variable before running. I'll test running the script with `WEATHERVANE_DISABLE_SCIPY=1` to see if it stabilizes execution without the segfault.

**Modifying heuristics to respect env variable**

I'll update the heuristics module to check the environment variable controlling SciPy usage before importing it. This way, if the user disables SciPy via env, we avoid importing it and set related variables like `LinearConstraint` and `differential_evolution` to `None` to prevent reference errors in fallback code.

summary.text:
**Modifying heuristics to respect env variable**

I'll update the heuristics module to check the environment variable controlling SciPy usage before importing it. This way, if the user disables SciPy via env, we avoid importing it and set related variables like `LinearConstraint` and `differential_evolution` to `None` to prevent reference errors in fallback code.

+import os

+else:  # pragma: no cover - explicit disable
+    differential_evolution = None
+    LinearConstraint = None

**Designing greedy budget allocation algorithm**

This chunk lays out a detailed plan for implementing a greedy algorithm to find an optimal budget allocation across cells, considering piecewise linear revenue curves and guardrails. I’m thinking through starting spends at minimum, incrementally allocating budget to the cell with the highest marginal ROI until the total budget is exhausted, handling edge cases like scaling down if minimum spends exceed total budget, and computing slopes between breakpoints to guide allocation. The plan involves replacing a prior candidate-level approach and refining the oracle solver in the stress test module accordingly.

float:\n    \"\"\"Piecewise linear interpolation over the curve.\"\"\"\n    if not curve:\n        return 0.0\n    if spend <= curve[0][0]:\n        baseline_spend, baseline_rev = curve[0]\n        if baseline_spend <= 0:\n            return baseline_rev\n        return (baseline_rev / baseline_spend) * spend\n    for idx in range(1, len(curve)):\n        prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[idx - 1]\n        curr_spend, curr_rev = curve[idx]\n        if spend <= curr_spend:\n            span = curr_spend - prev_spend\n            if span <= 0:\n                return curr_rev\n            weight = (spend - prev_spend) / span\n            return prev_rev + weight * (curr_rev - prev_rev)\n    last_spend, last_rev = curve[-1]\n    if len(curve) == 1:\n        return last_rev\n    prev_spend, prev_rev = curve[-2]\n    slope = 0.0\n    if last_spend != prev_spend:\n        slope = (last_rev - prev_rev) / (last_spend - prev_spend)\n    elif last_spend:\n        slope = last_rev / last_spend\n    return last_rev + slope * (spend - last_spend)\n\n\ndef _compute_profit(spends: Dict[str, float], curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]]) -> Tuple[float, Dict[str, float]]:\n    revenues: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    for cell, spend in spends.items():\n        curve = curves.get(cell, [(0.0, 0.0)])\n        revenues[cell] = _revenue_from_curve(curve, spend)\n    total_revenue = sum(revenues.values())\n    profit = total_revenue - sum(spends.values())\n    return profit, revenues\n\n\ndef _candidate_spend_levels(curve: Sequence[CurvePoint], guardrails: Guardrails) -> List[float]:\n    values = {guardrails.min_spend, guardrails.max_spend}\n    for spend, _ in curve:\n        values.add(min(max(spend, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.max_spend))\n    return sorted(values)\n\n\ndef _solve_oracle(\n    cells: Sequence[str],\n    total_budget: float,\n    current_spend: Dict[str, float],\n    guardrails: Guardrails,\n    curves: Dict[str, Sequence[CurvePoint]],\n) -> Tuple[Dict[str, float], float]:\n    \"\"\"Brute-force search over curve breakpoints to approximate optimal profit.\"\"\"\n    if not cells:\n        return {}, 0.0\n\n    best_spends: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    best_profit = -math.inf\n    tol = 1e-3\n\n    def backtrack(idx: int, remaining_budget: float, partial: Dict[str, float]) -> None:\n        nonlocal best_spends, best_profit\n        cell = cells[idx]\n        curve = curves[cell]\n        levels = _candidate_spend_levels(curve, guardrails)\n\n        if idx == len(cells) - 1:\n            spend = max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, remaining_budget))\n            if abs(spend - remaining_budget) > tol:\n                return\n            candidate = {**partial, cell: spend}\n            profit, _ = _compute_profit(candidate, curves)\n            if profit > best_profit + tol:\n                best_profit = profit\n                best_spends = candidate\n            return\n\n        for spend in levels:\n            if spend < guardrails.min_spend - tol or spend > guardrails.max_spend + tol:\n                continue\n            next_remaining = remaining_budget - spend\n            if next_remaining < (len(cells) - idx - 1) * guardrails.min_spend - tol:\n                continue\n            if next_remaining > (len(cells) - idx - 1) * guardrails.max_spend + tol:\n                continue\n            partial[cell] = spend\n            backtrack(idx + 1, next_remaining, partial)\n            partial.pop(cell, None)\n\n    backtrack(0, total_budget, {})\n    if not best_spends:\n        # Fall back to evenly distributing the budget.\n        even_spend = total_budget / len(cells)\n        best_spends = {cell: max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, even_spend)) for cell in cells}\n        best_profit, _ = _compute_profit(best_spends, curves)\n    return best_spends, best_profit\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass StressTestConfig:\n    name: str\n    cells: Sequence[str]\n    total_budget: float\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float]\n    actual_roi_curves: Dict[str, Sequence[Dict[str, float]]]\n    current_spend: Dict[str, float]\n    guardrails: Guardrails\n    quantile_factors: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)\n    context_tags: Sequence[str] = field(default_factory=list)\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)\n\n    def cleaned_curves(self) -> Dict[str, List[CurvePoint]]:\n        return {cell: _build_curve(self.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])) for cell in self.cells}\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass StressTestResult:\n    name: str\n    allocation: AllocationResult\n    actual_profit: float\n    oracle_profit: float\n    regret: float\n    regret_pct: float\n    revenues: Dict[str, float]\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any]\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        payload = {\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"actual_profit\": self.actual_profit,\n            \"oracle_profit\": self.oracle_profit,\n            \"regret\": self.regret,\n            \"regret_pct\": self.regret_pct,\n            \"revenues\": self.revenues,\n            \"allocation\": {\n                \"spends\": self.allocation.spends,\n                \"profit\": self.allocation.profit,\n                \"diagnostics\": self.allocation.diagnostics,\n            },\n        }\n        if self.metadata:\n            payload[\"metadata\"] = self.metadata\n        return payload\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass StressSuiteReport:\n    results: List[StressTestResult]\n\n    @property\n    def worst_regret(self) -> float:\n        return max((result.regret for result in self.results), default=0.0)\n\n    @property\n    def worst_regret_pct(self) -> float:\n        return max((result.regret_pct for result in self.results), default=0.0)\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        return {\n            \"results\": [result.to_dict() for result in self.results],\n            \"worst_regret\": self.worst_regret,\n            \"worst_regret_pct\": self.worst_regret_pct,\n        }\n\n\ndef run_stress_test(config: StressTestConfig) -> StressTestResult:\n    curves = config.cleaned_curves()\n    context_tags = list(config.context_tags)\n    if \"history.short\" not in context_tags:\n        context_tags.append(\"history.short\")\n\n    allocation_input = AllocationInput(\n        cells=list(config.cells),\n        total_budget=config.total_budget,\n        current_spend=dict(config.current_spend),\n        expected_roas=dict(config.expected_roas),\n        roi_curves={cell: [dict(point) for point in config.actual_roi_curves.get(cell, [])] for cell in config.cells},\n        guardrails=config.guardrails,\n        context_tags=context_tags,\n        quantile_factors=dict(config.quantile_factors),\n    )\n    allocation = allocate(allocation_input)\n\n    actual_profit, revenues = _compute_profit(allocation.spends, curves)\n\n    oracle_spends, oracle_profit = _solve_oracle(\n        cells=list(config.cells),\n        total_budget=config.total_budget,\n        current_spend=dict(config.current_spend),\n        guardrails=config.guardrails,\n        curves=curves,\n    )\n\n    regret = max(oracle_profit - actual_profit, 0.0)\n    regret_pct = 0.0\n    if abs(oracle_profit) > 1e-6:\n        regret_pct = regret / abs(oracle_profit)\n\n    return StressTestResult(\n        name=config.name,\n        allocation=allocation,\n        actual_profit=float(actual_profit),\n        oracle_profit=float(oracle_profit),\n        regret=float(regret),\n        regret_pct=float(regret_pct),\n        revenues=revenues,\n        metadata=dict(config.metadata),\n    )\n\n\ndef default_stress_suite() -> StressSuiteReport:\n    base_guardrails = Guardrails(min_spend=50.0, max_spend=300.0, roas_floor=1.2, learning_cap=0.4)\n\n    moderate_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 80.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 220.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 430.0},\n    ]\n    steep_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 120.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 280.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 500.0},\n    ]\n    saturating_curve = [\n        {\"spend\": 50.0, \"revenue\": 100.0},\n        {\"spend\": 150.0, \"revenue\": 210.0},\n        {\"spend\": 300.0, \"revenue\": 360.0},\n    ]\n\n    scenarios = [\n        StressTestConfig(\n            name=\"balanced-curve\",\n            cells=(\"meta\", \"google\"),\n            total_budget=300.0,\n            current_spend={\"meta\": 120.0, \"google\": 120.0},\n            expected_roas={\"meta\": 2.4, \"google\": 2.0},\n            actual_roi_curves={\"meta\": steep_curve, \"google\": moderate_curve},\n            guardrails=base_guardrails,\n            metadata={\"focus\": \"baseline alignment\"},\n        ),\n        StressTestConfig(\n            name=\"underestimated-meta\",\n            cells=(\"meta\", \"google\", \"pinterest\"),\n            total_budget=450.0,\n            current_spend={\"meta\": 150.0, \"google\": 150.0, \"pinterest\": 120.0},\n            expected_roas={\"meta\": 1.6, \"google\": 2.1, \"pinterest\": 1.9},\n            actual_roi_curves={\"meta\": steep_curve, \"google\": moderate_curve, \"pinterest\": saturating_curve},\n            guardrails=base_guardrails,\n            metadata={\"focus\": \"response curve misspecification\"},\n        ),\n        StressTestConfig(\n            name=\"inventory-constrained\",\n            cells=(\"meta\", \"search\"),\n            total_budget=260.0,\n            current_spend={\"meta\": 140.0, \"search\": 140.0},\n            expected_roas={\"meta\": 2.0, \"search\": 1.8},\n            actual_roi_curves={\"meta\": moderate_curve, \"search\": saturating_curve},\n            guardrails=Guardrails(\n                min_spend=80.0,\n                max_spend=260.0,\n                roas_floor=1.1,\n                learning_cap=0.25,\n                inventory_available=3200.0,\n                avg_order_value=45.0,\n            ),\n            quantile_factors={\"p10\": 0.7, \"p50\": 1.0, \"p90\": 1.2},\n            metadata={\"focus\": \"inventory guardrail and quantiles\"},\n        ),\n    ]\n\n    results = [run_stress_test(config) for config in scenarios]\n    return StressSuiteReport(results=results)\n\n\ndef suite_to_json(report: StressSuiteReport) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    return report.to_dict()\n\n"
}

payload.text:
**Rewriting budget allocation algorithm**

I'm planning to replace the `_solve_oracle` function with a new approach that distributes budgets optimally across cells based on piecewise linear curves. I'll remove the obsolete `_candidate_spend_levels` and implement a refined iteration that allocates remaining budget fairly while handling curve segments and capacity correctly. The goal is to keep the marginal value computations accurate and ensure leftover budget is spread evenly in a stable loop.

{
  "path": "docs/DEVELOPMENT.md",
  "content": "# WeatherVane Developer Guide\n\n## Prerequisites\n- Python 3.11+\n- Node.js 18+\n- Docker + Docker Compose (optional but recommended)\n- Make\n\n## Initial Setup\n```bash\ncp .env.example .env\nmake bootstrap\n```\n\nThis installs Python dependencies in editable mode and installs web dependencies under `apps/web`.\n\n## Running Services Locally\n- **API:** `make api` (runs on http://localhost:8000)\n- **Web:** `make web` (Next.js dev server on http://localhost:3000)\n- **Worker:** `make worker`\n- **Model stub:** `make model`\n\nUse `docker-compose up` to start Postgres plus containerised API/web/worker stacks. Source code is mounted for hot reloads.\n\n## Testing & Linting\n```bash\nmake lint\nmake test\n```\n\nThese run Ruff/ESLint and Pytest/Next.js tests respectively. Formatting helper:\n```bash\nmake format\n```\n\n### Worker / PoC Pipeline Dependencies\nThe worker CLI and PoC pipeline rely on scientific Python packages such as `polars`,\n`numpy`, and `scikit-learn`. Install the editable project dependency set before running\n`python apps/worker/run.py`:\n```bash\npip install -e .[dev]\n```\nIf the real Prefect package cannot be installed, the repository includes a lightweight\nshim under `prefect/` so flows can still execute locally. In constrained sandboxes you can\nalso install wheels into a per-repo directory and adjust `PYTHONPATH`, for example:\n```bash\npython -m pip install --target .deps polars numpy geohash2\nPYTHONPATH=.deps:. python apps/worker/run.py demo-tenant --start 2024-01-01 --end 2024-01-14\n```\nIf native wheels clash with the host BLAS/Accelerate libraries (manifesting as\nsegmentation faults on import), rebuild the dependencies inside a dedicated virtualenv or\nConda environment instead of the `.deps` shortcut. The allocator prefers `scipy` when\navailable, and the time-series helpers expect `lightgbm` linked against `libomp`—ensure\n`libomp.dylib` is present (Homebrew `libomp` or a source build with `USE_OPENMP=OFF`) when\nrunning the worker end-to-end. If LightGBM is unavailable, the code falls back to\n`HistGradientBoostingRegressor` so toy runs can still succeed, albeit with less accurate\nelasticity modelling.\n\nRun a quick end-to-end smoke of the worker + data-context plumbing via:\n```bash\nmake smoke-context\n```\nThis exercises the synthetic tenant path, emits context tags, and is safe to wire into CI.\n\n## Project Layout\n- `apps/api`: FastAPI app (routers, config, dependencies)\n- `apps/web`: Next.js marketing + app shell\n- `apps/worker`: Prefect flows and job runners\n- `apps/model`: Model training entrypoints\n- `apps/simulator`: Backtest/simulation utilities\n- `shared/schemas`: Pydantic models shared across services\n- `shared/libs`: Connector stubs, logging utilities, etc.\n- `infra`: Infrastructure-as-code (Terraform/Kubernetes placeholders)\n- `docker`: Container images for API and web\n\n## Environment Variables\nUpdate `.env` from the example with real credentials for Shopify, Meta Ads, Google Ads, and Klaviyo when wiring connectors. The API reads `CORS_ORIGINS`, `DATABASE_URL`, `LOG_LEVEL`, etc.\n\n### Context warning overrides\nData-context warnings drive the guardrail messaging that appears in the API responses,\nwebhooks, and UI context panels. By default the shared engine emits warnings for sparse\nhistory, missing ads feeds, weather stubs, and high-null datasets. To customise or extend\nthese rules, set `CONTEXT_WARNING_RULES` to a JSON array in `.env`:\n\n```env\nCONTEXT_WARNING_RULES=[\n  {\n    \"match\": \"history.short\",\n    \"severity\": \"info\",\n    \"message\": \"Coverage is short but acceptable for assisted pushes\"\n  },\n  {\n    \"match\": \"catalog.missing\",\n    \"severity\": \"critical\",\n    \"escalate_for_automation\": true,\n    \"message\": \"Catalog data unavailable; pause automated pushes until restated\"\n  }\n]\n```\n\nRules inherit missing fields (message/severity/escalation) from the default rule with the\nsame `match`. New matches are appended to the rule set. `escalate_for_automation` raises\nthe severity to `critical` whenever Autopilot or automated pushes are enabled.\n\n### Connector state\nIncremental connectors (e.g., Shopify orders) persist their cursors in\n`storage/metadata/state/<namespace>/<key>.json`. The helper `JsonStateStore` abstracts the\nread/write cycle so ingestors can resume from the last `updated_at` without manual wiring.\nFor local testing, the state directory lives under the repo root; in production point it at\na durable volume.\n\n### Retention sweep automation\nUse `python apps/worker/run.py --retention-only` to prune expired Parquet snapshots. Pass\n`ALL` (or `--all-tenants`) to sweep every tenant discovered in the lake and set\n`--retention-webhook-url` so ops dashboards receive a per-tenant `retention.sweep.completed`\nevent plus a nightly `retention.sweep.summary` that captures tag coverage and warning counts.\nProvide `--retention-summary-root` (for\nexample `storage/metadata/state`) to persist the aggregate JSON locally for dashboards or\naudit review, and `--context-root` when context snapshots live outside the default\n`storage/metadata/data_context`. The Prefect deployment template at\n`deployments/retention.yaml` defaults to automatic discovery; override the parameters or\ninject the webhook URL, summary root, and context root at build time (e.g. with Prefect\nblocks or CI secrets) before applying the schedule.\n`python apps/worker/run.py --retention-report --retention-summary-root storage/metadata/state`\nprints the latest summary on demand; append `--retention-report-day YYYY-MM-DD` to inspect\na specific nightly record.\n\n### Geocoding coverage checks\nThe PoC pipeline runs `evaluate_geocoding_coverage` after ingestion to ensure the latest\norders snapshot carries geohashes. The helper stores a JSON report under\n`storage/metadata/state/geocoding/<tenant>.json` with the sampled path, coverage ratio, and\nstatus (`ok`, `warning`, `critical`, etc.). Context tags (`geo.partial`, `geo.missing`) and the\npipeline response both surface the result so operators can intervene before weather joins\ndegrade.\n\n### Smoke testing the pipeline\nUse `python apps/worker/run.py <tenant> --smoke-test` to execute the PoC pipeline end-to-end. The\ncommand prints a JSON summary containing plan status, ingestion sources, row counts, and geocoding\ncoverage so you can diagnose missing connectors or degraded telemetry quickly. Without real API\ncredentials the pipeline falls back to synthetic stubs, which is fine for local Apple Silicon runs.\n\nRun the same check via `make smoke-pipeline` if you prefer Make shortcuts. The command uses the\n`.deps` virtual wheel directory so it behaves consistently with `make test` on Apple Silicon.\nAdd `--log-file logs/smoke.ndjson` (or set `LOG_FILE` env) to capture NDJSON entries for observability\npipelines.\n\n### Ingest→Feature→Plan harness\n- Synthetic path: `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/worker/ingest_to_plan_live/test_live_connectors.py::test_ingest_to_plan_harness_synthetic`\n  spins a tenant through ingest, feature, and plan stages using the stub connectors bundled with the repo.\n- Live path: export Shopify/Meta/Google Ads credentials (`SHOPIFY_SHOP_DOMAIN`, `SHOPIFY_ACCESS_TOKEN`,\n  `META_ACCESS_TOKEN`, `META_APP_ID`, `META_APP_SECRET`, `GOOGLEADS_DEVELOPER_TOKEN`, `GOOGLEADS_CUSTOMER_ID`,\n  `GOOGLEADS_REFRESH_TOKEN`, `GOOGLEADS_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID`, `GOOGLEADS_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET`) plus\n  `HARNESS_LIVE_TENANT`, then run `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest -m \"not slow\" tests/worker/ingest_to_plan_live -k live`.\n  Tests skip automatically when credentials are absent.\n- Metrics land under `tmp/metrics/<timestamp>/metrics.jsonl` by default; set `METRICS_OUTPUT_DIR` to override or\n  inspect per-run directories emitted by `shared.observability.metrics`. Events:\n  - `harness.summary` carries plan/geocoding status, connector sources, and dataset row counts.\n  - `harness.guardrails` records allocation diagnostics (MAE/RMSE/quantile width).\n  - `harness.window` logs the modeling lookback window.\n  - `harness.retention` fires when the harness triggers a retention sweep.\n- Tune lookback and retention knobs via env:\n  - `HARNESS_SYNTHETIC_LOOKBACK_DAYS` / `HARNESS_LIVE_LOOKBACK_DAYS` (default 30)\n  - `HARNESS_RETENTION_DAYS` (default 365) and `HARNESS_LIVE_TENANT` / `HARNESS_SYNTHETIC_TENANT`.\n- Harness helpers reuse the production `FeatureBuilder` to validate gradient-boosted defaults and weather joins.\n  After a run, inspect feature projections with `python -q <<'PY' ...` or rehydrate via\n  `FeatureBuilder().build(<tenant>, start, end)` to debug anomalies surfaced by the tests.\n\n### Dashboard exports\nUse `make export-observability` (or invoke `python apps/worker/maintenance/export_observability.py`) to\nwrite `retention.ndjson` and `geocoding.ndjson` under `observability/latest/`. These files are structured\nfor direct ingestion into BigQuery or Loki; the roadmap calls for wiring this export into a scheduled job.\n\n### Secrets checklist\nRun `python apps/worker/maintenance/secrets.py` (or `make check-secrets`) to verify required connector secrets are present in your\nenvironment. The command highlights missing required values (Shopify tokens/domains) and optional but\nrecommended credentials (Meta, Google Ads, Klaviyo). Use `--json` for CI-friendly output.\n\n## Next Steps Checklist\n- Implement real connector clients under `shared/libs/connectors`.\n- Add persistence layer (SQLAlchemy models, Alembic migrations).\n- Flesh out worker flows for ingestion, modeling, and allocation.\n- Connect frontend pages to live API endpoints.\n- Expand end-to-end tests and CI pipeline.\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

from apps.allocator.heuristics import AllocationInput, Guardrails, allocate
cells = ["meta"]
total_budget = 80.0
current_spend = {"meta": 70.0}
expected_roas = {"meta": 1.6}
guardrails = Guardrails(
    min_spend=60.0,
    max_spend=80.0,
    roas_floor=1.7,
    learning_cap=0.15,
    inventory_available=500.0,
    avg_order_value=50.0,
)
roi_curves = {
    "meta": [
        {"spend": 60.0, "roas": 1.5, "revenue": 90.0},
        {"spend": 80.0, "roas": 1.7, "revenue": 136.0},
    ]
}
result = allocate(
    AllocationInput(
        cells=cells,
        total_budget=total_budget,
        current_spend=current_spend,
        expected_roas=expected_roas,
        roi_curves=roi_curves,
        guardrails=guardrails,
    )
)
print(result.diagnostics)
PY"],"workdir":"/Volumes/BigSSD4/nathanielschmiedehaus/Documents/WeatherVane"}

scenario_profit\n            weight_sum += weight\n\n        if weight_sum <= 0:\n            weight_sum = 1.0\n        weighted_profit = sum(weight * scenario_profits[label] for label, _, weight in scenario_defs) / weight_sum\n        worst_profit = min(scenario_profits.values()) if scenario_profits else weighted_profit\n        risk_penalty = input_data.risk_aversion * max(weighted_profit - worst_profit, 0.0)\n\n        adjusted_profit = weighted_profit - roas_pen - learning_pen - inventory_pen - risk_penalty\n        penalty_diagnostics = {\n            \"risk_penalty\": float(risk_penalty),\n            \"roas_penalty\": float(roas_pen),\n            \"learning_penalty\": float(learning_pen),\n            \"inventory_penalty\": float(inventory_pen),\n            \"expected_profit_raw\": float(weighted_profit),\n            \"worst_case_profit\": float(worst_profit),\n        }\n        return adjusted_profit, scenario_profits, penalty_diagnostics\n\n    def objective(x: Sequence[float]) -> float:\n        adjusted_profit, _, _ = evaluate(x)\n        return -float(adjusted_profit)\n\n    if differential_evolution is None or \"history.short\" in input_data.total_budget)\n\n    result = differential_evolution(\n        objective,\n        bounds=bounds,\n        seed=seed,\n        maxiter=300,\n        polish=True,\n scenario_profits, penalty_info = evaluate(final_vector)\n    objective_value = -adjusted_profit\n\n    binding_min: List[str] = []\n    binding_max: List[str] = []\n    binding_roas: List[str] = []\n    binding_learning: List[str] = []\n    tol = 1e-3\n\n    for cell, spend in spends.items():\n        if abs(spend - guardrails.min_spend) <= tol:\n            binding_min.append(cell)\n        if abs(spend - guardrails.max_spend) <= tol:\n            binding_max.append(cell)\n        roas = roas_for(cell, spend)\n        if guardrails.roas_floor and abs(roas - guardrails.roas_floor) <= tol:\n            binding_roas.append(cell)\n        base = max(input_data.current_spend.get(cell, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.min_spend, tol)\n        delta = abs(spend - base) / base\n        if delta >= max(guardrails.learning_cap - tol, 0.0):\n            binding_learning.append(cell)\n\n    conversions = None\n    inventory_utilization = None\n    if guardrails.inventory_available:\n        conversions = sum(\n            (roas_for(cell, spends[cell]) * spends[cell]) / guardrails.avg_order_value if guardrails.avg_order_value else 0.0\n            for cell in cells\n        )\n        inventory_utilization = conversions / guardrails.inventory_available if guardrails.inventory_available else None\n\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"success\": float(result.success),\n        \"nfev\": float(result.nfev),\n        \"objective_value\": float(objective_value),\n        \"binding_min_spend\": binding_min,\n        \"binding_max_spend\": binding_max,\n        \"binding_roas_floor\": binding_roas,\n        \"binding_learning_cap\": binding_learning,\n    }\n    diagnostics.update({f\"scenario_profit_{label}\": float(value) for label, value in scenario_profits.items()})\n    diagnostics.update(penalty_info)\n    if conversions is not None:\n        diagnostics[\"conversions_estimate\"] = float(conversions)\n    if inventory_utilization is not None:\n        diagnostics[\"inventory_utilization\"] = float(inventory_utilization)\n\n    return AllocationResult(spends=spends, profit=float(adjusted_profit), diagnostics=diagnostics)\n\n\ndef _fallback_allocate(\n    input_data: AllocationInput,\n    revenue_for,\n    roas_for,\n) -> AllocationResult:\n    cells = input_data.cells\n    guardrails = input_data.guardrails\n\n    spends: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    for cell in cells:\n        base = max(input_data.current_spend.get(cell, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.min_spend, 1e-6)\n        spends[cell] = min(base, guardrails.max_spend)\n\n    current_total = sum(spends.values())\n    total_budget = input_data.total_budget\n\n    if current_total > total_budget and current_total > 0:\n        scale = total_budget / current_total\n        for cell in cells:\n            spends[cell] = max(guardrails.min_spend, min(guardrails.max_spend, spends[cell] * scale))\n        current_total = sum(spends.values())\n\n    remaining = max(total_budget - current_total, 0.0)\n    weights = []\n    for cell in cells:\n        weight = float(input_data.expected_roas.get(cell, 0.0))\n        if weight <= 0:\n            weight = 1e-6\n        weights.append(weight)\n    weight_sum = sum(weights) or len(cells)\n\n    for cell, weight in zip(cells, weights):\n        if remaining <= 0:\n            break\n        capacity = max(guardrails.max_spend - spends[cell], 0.0)\n        if capacity <= 0:\n            continue\n        share = remaining * (weight / weight_sum)\n        allocation = min(capacity, share)\n        spends[cell] += allocation\n        remaining -= allocation\n\n    if remaining > 1e-6:\n        for cell in cells:\n            if remaining <= 0:\n                break\n            capacity = max(guardrails.max_spend - spends[cell], 0.0)\n            take = min(capacity, remaining)\n            spends[cell] += take\n            remaining -= take\n\n    revenues = {cell: revenue_for(cell, spend) for cell, spend in spends.items()}\n    profit = sum(revenues.values()) - sum(spends.values())\n\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"success\": 0.0,\n        \"nfev\": 0.0,\n        \"objective_value\": float(-profit),\n        \"binding_min_spend\": [cell for cell, spend in spends.items() if abs(spend - guardrails.min_spend) <= 1e-3],\n        \"binding_max_spend\": [cell for cell, spend in spends.items() if abs(spend - guardrails.max_spend) <= 1e-3],\n        \"binding_roas_floor\": [\n            cell\n            for cell, spend in spends.items()\n            if guardrails.roas_floor and abs(roas_for(cell, spend) - guardrails.roas_floor) <= 1e-3\n        ],\n        \"binding_learning_cap\": [],\n        \"fallback_alloc\": True,\n        \"scenario_profit_p50\": float(profit),\n        \"risk_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"roas_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"learning_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"inventory_penalty\": 0.0,\n        \"expected_profit_raw\": float(profit),\n        \"worst_case_profit\": float(profit),\n    }\n\n    return AllocationResult(spends=spends, profit=float(profit), diagnostics=diagnostics)\n"
}
